noun.description: In the Hawaiian Islands: either of two trees of the myrtle family, the lehua, Metrosideros polymorpha (more fully "ohia lehua"), and the Malay apple, Syzygium malaccense (more fully "ohia ai").

origin: Early 19th century. From Hawaiian ʽōhiʽa (also more fully ʽōhiʽa-lehua flowering ohia, ʽōhiʽa-ʽai edible ohia).
